column1: Support VSTS as a package feed
column45:
Currently, you can use VSTS as a package feed with the nuget client ([https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/package/nuget/nuget-exe?view=vsts|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/package/nuget/nuget-exe?view=vsts)]

However, trying to proxy a VSTS feed in Artifactory fails, likely because the package download path for the actual package leads to a metadata page? 

-For example, installing directly from vsts:

nuget install VSTS-Helloworld -Source testfeed -Verbosity detailed
 NuGet Version: 4.7.0.5148
 Feeds used:
 [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2]

Installing package 'VSTS-Helloworld' to '/Users/mattheww/Downloads'.
 GET [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='VSTS-Helloworld'&semVerLevel=2.0.0|https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/FindPackagesById()?id=%27VSTS-Helloworld%27&semVerLevel=2.0.0]
 OK [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='VSTS-Helloworld'&semVerLevel=2.0.0|https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/FindPackagesById()?id=%27VSTS-Helloworld%27&semVerLevel=2.0.0] 553ms

Resolved actions to install package 'VSTS-Helloworld.1.0.2'
 Retrieving package 'VSTS-HelloWorld 1.0.2' from 'testfeed'.
 GET [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/Packages(Id='VSTS-HelloWorld',Version='1.0.2]')
 OK [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/Packages(Id='VSTS-HelloWorld',Version='1.0.2]') 404ms
 Adding package 'VSTS-HelloWorld.1.0.2' to folder '/Users/mattheww/Downloads'
 Added package 'VSTS-HelloWorld.1.0.2' to folder '/Users/mattheww/Downloads'
 Added package 'VSTS-HelloWorld.1.0.2' to folder '/Users/mattheww/Downloads' from source 'https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2'
 Successfully installed 'VSTS-HelloWorld 1.0.2' to /Users/mattheww/Downloads

-The metadata is  [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2/Packages(Id='VSTS-HelloWorld',Version='1.0.2')] which returns the following URL presumably as the download url for the actual package:

<content type="application/zip" src="https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2?id=vsts-helloworld&version=1.0.2" />

-However, viewing in a web browser [https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2?id=vsts-helloworld&version=1.0.2|https://uriahl.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/testfeed2/nuget/v2?id=vsts-helloworld&version=1.0.2] doesn't download the actual package

 

It is not clear what the Nuget Download Context Path or the Feed Context Path should be on Artifactory's side
column249:
20/Apr/19 2:44 AM;david.alpert;I am having a very similar problem; in my case the download URL returned by the VSTS atom/xml feed *does download as expected* when called from a browser directly or curl or postman with the correct authentication to reach the VSTS feeds.

Nonetheless, Artifactory appears to be *ignoring* the URL provided by VSTS in the {{<content .../>}} element of the atom/xml feed and instead constructing it's own download URL based on an assumption that all nuget feeds follow the default nuget repo layout used by nuget.org.

From a support ticket today:
{quote}
Currently, there is no repository setting change that would make Artifactory form a download URL that VSTS can accept, because Artifactory constructs a download URL similar to what nuget.org supports. For example, the download URL for nuget.org is "GET /api/v2/package/Microsoft.AspNetCore/1.1.0-preview1-final", where the download context path is api/v2/package, and the <package>/<version> is appended after the download context path. 

However, there is no download path for VSTS, while the format that is expected is ?id=<package>&version=<version>, which Artifactory currently doesn't support.
{quote}

In other words, despite being able to succesfully read a metadata feed from a VSTS nuget feed, Artifactory *ignores* the metadata in that feed and *assumes that the download path follows nuget.org conventions*.

This makes Artifactory version 6.7.1 useless as a proxy to nuget feeds hosted by VSTS.
column250: 22/Apr/19 10:37 PM;david.alpert;request that this ticket be increased in priority to *Blocker*
column251: 13/Jun/19 7:38 AM;leepowell;This is a massive issue for us too. However we can't even get Artifactory to authenticate against VSTS. I agree with David Alpert that this should be raised to a blocker.

column1: Support client certificated-based LDAP authentication
column45:
Artifactory can currently be configured with a username and password for LDAP search authentication.  This feature request is to add support for the configuration of client certificates for LDAP search authentication, rather than configuring a username and password (note that _client certificates_ are distinct from the _server certificates_ used for LDAPS).

This feature request resulted from support case 86632.

column1: (Auth0 integration) Force Artifactory to check the existence of an account
column45:
Currently, Artifactory can use the [Auth0|https://auth0.com/] SSO service as an OAuth provider. The Auth0 service also [exposes a REST API|https://auth0.com/docs/api/info] backend so applications can check users' authentication for non-SSO backend access.

This would allow users to use their AD password or the Artifactory API key while maintaining security protocols, such as disabling invalid accounts.

Currently the workaround is to use a [User Plugin|https://github.com/jfrog/artifactory-user-plugins/tree/master/security/cleanExternalUsers] to check for the existence of users on the OAuth provider.

column1: Allow selecting release bundles for Xray indexing
Delegate release bundles events to Xray
column45:
As part of the Artifactory/Xray integration, Artifactory sends events to Xray on every change in artifact or build in resources that were selected for indexing.

This feature is about extending the same mechanism to also send events about release bundles, such as:
 * release bundle version was added
 * release bundle version was modified
 * release bundle version was deleted

Each event should include the following information:
 * Instance name
 * release bundle name
 * release bundle version
 * updated manifest (list of artifacts, not AQL)

column1: Send the groups the user is member of as part of any request to Xray
column45:
download requests and package/artifact details requests should pass the groups the user is a member of.

This is a dependency for a very important feature in Xray: *personalized component information*.

Here is some background about the feature:

Today, every component has a single status, based on the top severity of the violations and vulnerabilities of it's latest version. This is not good enough because it assumes that all users share the same logic and policies. Since this is not always the situation in real life, and some teams and projects share the same repositories, Xray needs to reflect the relevant status to each user, based on the policies assigned to his watches/projects.

column1: Jenkins .hpi plugin feed support
column45: The request is for Artifactory to support external feeds of Jenkins .hpi plugins (as example delivered from [https://updates.jenkins.io/download/|https://updates.jenkins.io/download/,]). Internal workarounds proves to be inconvenient and troublesome.
column46: On-premise Artifactory application with explicitly controlled access to internet. Proxy openings have to be evaluated for each external feed.
column249:
18/Oct/18 12:19 PM;michael.jung;This seems like what we are also looking for:

An artifactory component serving jenkins plugins, such that we can deploy our internal plugins in artifactory and they can then be pullled by Jenkins installations.
Currently, plugins must be downloaded as a regular jar and uploaded into each Jenkins installation by hand. I am looking for something like [https://github.com/yandex-qatools/juseppe] to be added with this: [https://plugins.jenkins.io/update-sites-manager].

If this is not sufficiently close, I would turn this into a separate feature request.

column1: Improve package discovery
column45:
Our company has been using artifactory more and more over the last few years. Our growth in our npm repository in particular has been astronomical. Unfortunately, this means that it is increasingly hard to find packages. Artifactory's built in search only seems to cover package names and versions.

 

We are hoping for some more features like npmjs.org, crates.io, or pypi.org where search looks at the package descriptions, arbitrary user tags, and other metadata that comes from the package itself. The home pages for a package on those registries with integrated READMEs, project info, etc. are icing on the cake that make it much easier to find packages.

 

We are also in the process of deploying the xray product which gives us more search flexibility, but the metadata it searches does not seem end-user friendly and seems geared towards compliance tools.

 

We're aware of searching through fields like `npm.description`. However, we'd still like to request that the usability of these features be improved. For our end-users its difficult for them to know how to go the the property search page, and which properties to use. When I use npmjs.com or pypi.org when I do a package search its unified over all of the package metadata.

 

Secondly, the way the results are displayed is not friendly to package consumers. If I search for a package it returns every version matching the description. It doesn't show the published package name, but rather the file e.g. my-package-0.2.0.tgz. There is no description of the package displayed on this page, you need to click the "show in tree" button which is not too intuitive unless you're an admin, then you need to click over the to the "npm info" tab. In contrast if I search on npm, I'm greeted with these friendly results (see attached) with easy access to the relevant details of the package for a consumer.

column1: API to request storage optimization/balancing for a single binary
column45:
This is one of the dependencies of the Aspera/NetApp external replicator integration with Artifactory.

Create a mechanism to request storage optimization/balancing for a single binary when we know that an external replication mechanism may be causing the storage units to be unbalanced. Right now, this feature is attached to GC and can only be executed to all binaries in the binary store. This would be handful for scenarios where we know an external replication solution is producing unbalanced storage units and could be used to proactively request Artifactory to fix it.

Full detail of the external replicator integration design is here:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hTzWrKSIA28a1PTiZP7RMUkkUp6-YDKnEqkEckQqoeM/edit?usp=sharing]

column1: API to check the full path of a binary within the binary provider
column45:
This is one of the dependencies of the Aspera/NetApp external replicator integration with Artifactory.

Create a mechanism to get the path to the binary in a given binary provider. Knowing the path to the binary is necessary to inform the external replicator which file needs to be transferred.

Full detail of the external replicator integration design is here:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hTzWrKSIA28a1PTiZP7RMUkkUp6-YDKnEqkEckQqoeM/edit?usp=sharing]

column1: API to check which which shard contains a copy of a binary
column45:
This is one of the dependencies of the Aspera/NetApp external replicator integration with Artifactory.

Create a mechanism to check if the binary has gone all the way through the binary providers chain and which shards have a replica of the binary. This could be used by the custom replication logic to decide whether to trigger the external replicator or not. To workaround the absence of this API to discover which shards have a copy of the binary, we are sending a request to the Aspera Servers to check which one of them are attached to a shard that has a copy of the file

Full detail of the external replicator integration design is here:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hTzWrKSIA28a1PTiZP7RMUkkUp6-YDKnEqkEckQqoeM/edit?usp=sharing]

column1: Disable redeploy on maven release repository types
column45:
Please disable the ability to redeploy artifacts on Maven Repository that is handled for release artifacts.

While the permissions can be set to disable delete/overwrite, this causes issues for accounts that have manage rights to the repository.

Scenario:

We are migrating from Nexus to Artifactory. Nexus Maven repositories when configured will block any redeploy for release repositories, regardless of the permissions granted to the account. Our onboard process grants access by using LDAP groups.

Once we found out that Artifactory Maven release repositories will allow redeploy, we now have to re-evaluate how we will onboard teams.
column249: 18/Sep/20 6:10 PM;gpettey;Immutable releases are a rather important attribute of Maven. Please implement this.

column1: Licenses dont attach automatically for an artifact in Artifactory
column45:
Currently there no automatic scan for this in Artifactory, in case you want to attach the licenses in Artifactory you need to hit the scan button manually.
 
However, Xray scan the licenses and you can set [watchers|https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/XRAY/Watches] to get notifications about vulnerability licenses, but it will not attach the license in Artifactory.

column1: Mass uploads of license information to Artifactory
column45:
Currently, the Artifactory Admin->Licenses page offers an export function but not an import function. For large sets of license information, it is pretty slow to set license information one at a time. 

 

Currently there is no option to mass-update the configuration file for the licenses since it is found as a blob in Artifactory's DataBase.
 It is not recommended to change configuration directly in the DataBase, as this configuration may have different pointers and references through Artifactory's code and changing configuration in the DataBase may cause issues in Artifactory.

column1: Docker execution point
column45:
currently if i push a docker image to a docker repo within artifactory this is handled for each layer of the image as own event within the context of a user plugin.

maybe there could be an own execution point that can be used as single point for an docker image, also this exec point should be able to forward the correct http status code, which with the current execution point (storage) seems not to be so (regardless what statuscode is defined within the CancelException  the docker client which pushes is not recognizing it wich leads to endless retries of the push or curious outputs on the client side)

 

would be happy to hear from you whether you take this into account or not :)

column1: YAML GET API
Add Service account type and an option not to expire Service account passwords
column45:
*Story:*

As an Artifactory administrator
I want to disable password expiration on special user accounts (e.g. service accounts)
Even when the security settings have password expiration enabled for other accounts
So that I don't get caught up by surprise when dependencies stop working

*Scenario:*
We use built-in Artifactory accounts and have a strict security configuration with password expiration policy. We also have a *Services* group in Artifactory which contains all user accounts for our various services which connect to Artifactory, like Bamboo agents (svc_bamboo user), Terraform automation (svc_terraform user) etc. The mailboxes of these services are not generally monitored, so when the passwords of these services expire and a notification email is sent to their relative mailboxes, we normally don't know about it and then we need to manually unexpire the accounts when we realize something has stopped working (e.g. Bamboo can't connect to Artifactory).

It would be great, if we can automatically rotate passwords, but it isn't practical to do this e.g. in Bamboo so we have decided to stick with unexpiring password for some of our services. It would be great however if we can set a flag on user accounts to avoid handling this manually.

To maintain a homogeneous SSO authentication with all of our tools in Azure we need OAuth SSO with OpenID provider.

column1: Directly download NuGet packages within an Azure ARM template using a API key in the URI
column45:
We must be able to directly download required NuGet packages within Azure ARM templates when deploying Azure Automation accounts
 # Having the ability to download packages from a private repo without having to use the access token in HTTP request header. In MyGet, we can embed the authorization token as part of the URL, but for Artifactory, currently, you can only use the authorization token in the HTTP request header in Artifactory, which is not going to work for us because we are referencing the packages located in private feeds in ARM template in the form of a URL. We cannot add HTTP headers in an ARM template.

We must be able to embed the API key as part of the URL. We cannot use API keys in the HTTP header when calling the API because this scenario does not support the use of HTTP headers. For example, right now when using a MyGet private feed, the source location for the feed would be *[https://www.myget.org/F/]<feed name>/auth/<api key>/api/v2*. I can't find any documentation on how to use the Artifactory API key. It shows me I have to use the key in HTTP Headers.

column1: Jenkins Artifactory plugin should have fixed built-in exclude patterns
column45:
Currently, the Jenkins-Artifactory plugin (v2.12) provides *exclude patterns* when "Include Environment Variables" is enabled, to prevent environment variable with names that match any exclude pattern from being published to the build info tab in Artifactory in clear text format!  YIKES. Three values are currently auto-populated into this editable *exclude patterns* field (*password*,*key*,*secret*).  But we want these patterns to be fixed and not editable because users can remove them and obtain passwords or secrets for shared build accounts.

Feature request summary: 

1. The plugin should enforce a fixed/built-in set of *non-editable* exclude patterns (*password*,*key*,*secret*)*. T*hese fixed patterns should be case insensitive.

2. The plugin can continue to offer (as it does today) an editable set of exclude patterns that would be appended to the fixed/built-in set.

This is currently an audit issue.

column1: Allow file spec / AQL to download from virtuals
column45:
Symptoms: When attempting to pull files from a virtual repository, the Jenkins Artifactory plugin will instead pull directly from the local repository where it found the file. This can interfere with JAR Signing and other virtual repository functions.

The Jenkins Artifactory Plugin's file spec system relies on the Artifactory Query language, which currently does not support virtual repository download URLs.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Use a download spec that contains the path of the virtual repository as a part of the *pipeline build:spec= """{*

              *"files": [* 

*{                                     "pattern": "libs-snapshot/gradle-example-minimal/1.0-SNAPSHOT/gradle-example-minimal-1.0-SNAPSHOT.pom",                   "target": "project/"       }*

*]}"""*


 *server.download spec: downloadSpec*

2. Run the build

3. Observe in the request logs that the CI Server requests the local file, rather than the virtual file:

20180615134413|7|REQUEST|127.0.0.1|admin|POST|/api/search/aql|HTTP/1.1|200|204

20180615134413|2|REQUEST|127.0.0.1|admin|HEAD|/libs-snapshot-local/gradle-example-minimal/1.0-SNAPSHOT/gradle-example-minimal-1.0-SNAPSHOT.pom|HTTP/1.1|200|0

20180615134413|3|REQUEST|127.0.0.1|admin|GET|/libs-snapshot-local/gradle-example-minimal/1.0-SNAPSHOT/gradle-example-minimal-1.0-SNAPSHOT.pom|HTTP/1.1|200|402

Users should be able to specify a repository to use including virtual repositories in the Artifactory Query Language.

Loading composer repositories with package information

Problem 1

column1: More Granular Repo Local Backup Capabilities
column45:
Currently, the integrated local repo backup product feature is 'all or nothing', meaning you either a) specify a retention period (default is 168 hours or 7 days) and Artifactory takes takes a fresh, complete backup every time the retention period is reached, or, b) you click incremental and Artifactory will take a baseline backup and a daily (not sure is this is adjustable) incremental backup every day thereafter (FOREVER).  Both methods are disk space inefficient and require some level of admin oversight to maintain.

I am requesting that JFrog implement a third option (which is sort of a hybrid of the two current approached).  The feature would work like this: 1) baseline backup performed on day one; 2) incremental backups taken every day thereafter; 3) when the number of daily incremental backups taken equals the number specified as the 'retention period', a new baseline backup is taken and the cycle repeats.

column1: Xray should inherit Permission Targets from Artifactory
column45: A lot of effort has gone into setting up permissions to artifacts in Artifactory, using permission targets.  It would seem appropriate that those permission targets could be accessible in Xray to provide permissions.  Even better, automatically allow viewing of components and watches based on read ability in Artifactory.
column249: 15/Oct/18 6:55 PM;kerry.hardinger;Perhaps viewing of components and watches in Xray should be based on the ability to publish/promote in Artifactory and not read, to show it to those that can fix and not to all that can use.

column1: Export configuration to YAML

Hi,

I would like to export the configuration of a running Artifactory instance to YAML.
Right now it's only possible to export the configs to XML with the configuration and security descriptor menu options.

The reason is just, that I want to switch to YAML configuration files only, because they are a lot easier to handle with my configuration management system and easier to read.
But it's way to cumbersome to rewrite the whole configuration from scratch, test it and so on.
A simple export option would make this much easier.


Best,

Frank

column1: Unable to assign headers from a user plugin
column45:
he download event-handler, from the user plugin, is not setting custom headers in the alternative response by setting the context variable “headers” in the altResponse closure.

For example, we have a plugin:

_download (_
_altResponse{_

_request, responseRepoPath ->_

_log.info(“testing”)_

_headers = [“foo”: “bar”]_

_}_
 _}_

*Result:*

Running curl -uadmin:password -X GET [http://localhost:8081/artifactory/generic-local/testfile.txt] -D dumpheaders.txt, the custom added header does not appear in the header dump file although the “testing” log info can be seen.

*Expected Result:*
The custom header should have been added as an alternative response that could be view when doing a header dump or when using curl option “-I” to view header information.

column1: Make proxy setting configurable for NTLM authentication to avoid potential issue with basic authentication.
column45:
When proxy authentication is set in Artifactory, Artifactory will try using basic authentication before NTLM ( if enabled ). The basic authentication may be vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attack when the connection from Artifactory to the proxy server is non-ssl. Many proxy does not expected http basic auth or can be configured to not use one. It could be useful that artifactory can be configured to send out nltm only to proxy.

 

Steps to reproduce:

 
 # setup an proxy server that allow ntlm auth only.
 # add the prxoy in Artifactory and add authentication.
 # appley the prxoy to any remote repo and test connection
 # use http logger to monitor the http connection from Artifactory to the proxy server.

 

 

======================ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION============================

We have proxy with NTLM authentication. Unfortunately, Artifactory tries to use basic credential first before trying NTLM, which makes it vulnerable to MITM attacks.

column1: Password rotation policy on one user, not all users
column45:
Request:

I would like to request a solution that allows me to specify a certain user's password expiration policy, as opposed to the entire application.

Reason:

Many companies use a separate tool to manage LDAP, which often has its own password expiration policy, therefore the out of the box Artifactory rotation doesn't work.

column1: Support for multiple package types under common namespace
column45:
Many of out applications are polyglot and so use multiple repos to host the various package types being used as dependencies. Would be good if we could have all these repos (pertaining to same app) under a common namespace and sub-namespace the individual repos under it, based on type. This would allow allow all layers of an app to build by referencing Artifactory the same way, the sub-namespace being implicitly derived from type.

e.g. An app with appcode 'ABC' would have a top-level namespace as ABC and the individual repos could be 'ABC-mvn', 'ABC-npm', etc; such that Maven and Node can both use ABC as a repo.

column1: Replicator support Windows
column45:
Currently, Windows is not supported for replicator.

This task is first to evaluate the effort to support replicator on Windows.

column1: Service support for replicator
Allow copy from Generic repository to any other repo type
column45:
This is a request to allow copy/move operations from a Generic repository to any other repository type.

Currently only the other way is available. (i.e. copy/move from any repo to a Generic repository).

column1: LDAP group sync
column45:
{color:#000000}We need associate external (LDAP backed) groups with permission targets RESTfully. As a prerequisite, we would need to sync these LDAP groups (filtered based on naming patterns) to Artifactory and then associate them with permission targets to limit the scope.{color}

{color:#000000}We have created a support ticket (Ticket No.79355) earlier but, we were told such a functionality was unavailable and re-directed us to open a request in jira. This is a must have feature for us in order to fulfill our Architecture teams requirement inorder to fully utilize Artifactory.{color}

column1: Artifactory should be able to replicate single artifact to specified/rest Artifactory instances.
column45:
Artifactory should be able to replicate (copy) just ONE or multiple artifacts to specified/rest Artifactory instances.
One of the possible solutions: download artifact and then upload it to another instance, or add it to an already replicating repository.

Artifactory should be able to provide a more simple way to do it.

column1: Remote LFS support for BitBucket Server / Data Center
column45:
Currently, remote LFS is only supported for GitHub or Artifactory LFS endpoints,

We would like to be able to use BitBucket Server as LFS endpoints

column1: Pass on Query Params to a remote repository
NPM latest based on date instead of semver for a specific NPM registry
column45:
Currently, when we fetch a "latest" package from an NPM repository we get the latest based on the version. As the version contains a hash (based in the GIT commit ID) the latest we see is not the latest one published (as it's based on alphabetical order).

We'd like to have to latest, based on date published.

Changing the artifactory.system.properties file in \{ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc will affect the artifactory behaviour in regards to all NPM registries in Artifactory.

It would really help in our daily basis work if there was a way to change this behaviour to a specific NPM registry.

column1: Allow replication to rewrite conflicting files
column45:
When replication is set up, if there is a file of the same name as the replicating folder, the replication job will fail.

It would be useful for customers to be able to optionally overwrite any conflicting files of this nature.

The use case would be for a situation where users deploy packages incorrectly (as a file rather than folder), or if users are publishing files in places they are not supposed to.

column1: retry to connect with LDAP server, when tcp connections fails with existing LDAP server
column45:
Artifactory shall perform a configurable number of retries to connect with LDAP server when connection attempt with LDAP server fails or existing connection goes down (due to one of the LDAP server is taken out of the service or went down).

Generally, a FQDN is set up in DNS so that DNS resolves the FQDN to the IP of one out of a set of LDAP servers; with this mechanism, FQDN remains same but LDAP servers behind the FQDN can be changed or scaled up or down, as needed.

column1: Artifactory outputs important files being created.
column45:
As there are a few files that are critical to the software working properly, Artifactory should output during the installation process the files that are created and their permissions.

This will help detect issues earlier and allows more transparency with the user.

column1: Check for user permission consistency
column45:
If the artifactory.sh script is run as root on a service installation it will override some files owned by the root user and cause permission issues.

Artifactory should check the permission of the other files to make sure that the user that runs the script doesn't cause issues with the software.

A situation where this could happen is if a service installation goes wrong and files are missing (or if somehow any file is deleted) and then the artifactory.sh script is run as a different user.

column1: Support Terraform Module Registry
column45:
*User story*
As a developer I need a Terraform Module repository in which I can manage my modules with the rest of my dependencies in Artifactory

*Notes*
[Terraform Registry API Documentation|https://www.terraform.io/docs/registry/api.html]
column249: 26/Mar/19 2:13 PM;pkahn;Could the existing git or github repository remote repo options be used for this?  If so, a tech note on the jfrog wiki would provide an MVP for this goal.
column250:
23/Aug/19 3:14 PM;jakauppila;The benefit of having a real Terraform-registry compatible alternative is that it would allow for semver version referencing within the Terraform configurations whereas with Git you can only specify a specific tag.
{code:java}
The version attribute value may either be a single explicit version or a version constraint expression. Constraint expressions use the following syntax to specify a range of versions that are acceptable:

>= 1.2.0: version 1.2.0 or newer
<= 1.2.0: version 1.2.0 or older
~> 1.2.0: any non-beta version >= 1.2.0 and < 1.3.0, e.g. 1.2.X
~> 1.2: any non-beta version >= 1.2.0 and < 2.0.0, e.g. 1.X.Y
>= 1.0.0, <= 2.0.0: any version between 1.0.0 and 2.0.0 inclusive

When depending on third-party modules, references to specific versions are recommended since this ensures that updates only happen when convenient to you.

For modules maintained within your organization, a version range strategy may be appropriate if a semantic versioning methodology is used consistently or if there is a well-defined release process that avoids unwanted updates.

Version constraints are supported only for modules installed from a module registry, such as the Terraform Registry orTerraform Cloud's private module registry. Other module sources can provide their own versioning mechanisms within the source string itself, or might not support versions at all. In particular, modules sourced from local file paths do not support version; since they're loaded from the same source repository, they always share the same version as their caller.
{code}
 [https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/modules.html#module-versions]

column1: Add ostree support
column45:
OSTree is an upgrade system for Linux-based operating systems that performs atomic upgrades of complete filesystem trees. 

Because OSTree is designed for deploying core operating systems, a comparison with traditional "package managers" such as dpkg and rpm is illustrative. Packages are traditionally composed of partial filesystem trees with metadata and scripts attached, and these are dynamically assembled on the client machine, after a process of dependency resolution.

In contrast, OSTree only supports recording and deploying complete (bootable) filesystem trees. It has no built-in knowledge of how a given filesystem tree was generated or the origin of individual files, or dependencies, descriptions of individual components. Put another way, OSTree only handles delivery and deployment; you will likely still want to include inside each tree metadata about the individual components that went into the tree. 
https://ostree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/manual/introduction/

Please add ostree support (including things like automatic caching.)
https://ostree.readthedocs.io/en/latest/manual/repository-management/
column249:
07/Feb/20 9:12 PM;naganaidu;is this already implemented?

seems like this is request almost 2 years old ?

column1: Enhance Artifactory's WebDAV capabilities
column45:
We work with large files within Artifactory. Using http for file upload is challenging, especially when using Windows machines, and cURL may not be available.

While Artifactory has some support for WebDAV, it is feature limited and shows the sha256 file in addition to the original file, which can cause issues when downloading a directory for example.

Please enhance Artifactory to fully implement WebDAV and offer an option to hide the sha256 files.

Also consider supporting sftp and/or scp.

column1: Partner tracking of Licenses
column45:
*User story*
As a partner I need to be able to get credit for driving Artifactory trials and license purchases so that I can show that I am valuable to JFrog

Ideas for solutions:
* Partner buys a pool of licenses associated with that partner, then the partner's software inserts the license
* Partner's installer inserts a specific URL for landing page to get trial into Artifactory product so that on first connection to Artifactory UI the user is directed to a partner specific landing page which JFrog then tracks
* Partner's installer inserts a partner key into the URL, and then JFrog.com tracks trials and purchases using that key (e.g. https://jfrog.com/artifactory/free-trial/&partner=canonical)

column1: Add "Deny" permission setup in Artifactory
column45:
Say you have only 2-3 internal repositories contains important data, but also have other different types repositories should be public to all developers.

 

What we want to setup, we want to enable all local reader access to all readers, and cache access for remote repositories to all readers.

At the sametime, we want to disable the access for those important repositories from readers.

As we are continuously building new repositories for different purpose, but only have 2-3 secret repositories, we want to select “all Local” applies to readers.

If we have “deny” function, we can specify those internal repositories with deny permission to all readers. So whenever there is a new repositories (normally should be public) created, we don’t have to setup the permission group again for that repo.

 

Hope this make it more clear.

column1: Support GPG signatures for PyPI repositories
column45: Both setup.py upload and twine support uploading GPG signatures for published packages; these are sent in the request as gpg_signature parameter, yet this information is nowhere available in Artifactory. It would be good if the signatures were available for download as .asc files automatically.

column1: Support for the "docker push" command as a transaction.
column45:
Currently, the execution of one "docker push" command on the Docker client side is distributed on the Artifactory side for several operations. First, layers of images are loaded, then the manifest is loaded and finally labels with dockerfile are loaded as properties. The order of these operations is variable, depending on the Dockerfile content. For this reason, it is currently not possible to implement a plugin that, for example, would support the upload of the Docker image to the DTR in Artifactory. There is no event that would trigger execution of such a plugin.

It is necessary to create a special event, a transaction completion flag or any other mechanism that will enable the development of a user plugin to handle the event of introducing a new image to the DTR.
Such a plugin in our institution is necessary to check the correctness of image delivery by external providers (for example using Xray) and to free the webhook for further image processing.

column1: Artifactory (Oauth Provider)
column45:
*User Story*
As a platform administrator of the Artifactory Platform at Eli Lilly, I wold like to be able to use Artifactory as an Oauth Provider, so I can perform actions on behalf of a user and their access level, I cam able to get specific information about who that user is and their access levels in Artifactory.

*Further Information*
Here at Lilly, we use Service Now as the catalog tool, where people have requests for GitHub Repositories, Heroku applications, and Contentful spaces. Think of Service Now as the front door for creating things here at Lilly. One key item for this to work successfully, is we need to know who that user is in Artifactory, and what permissions they have to certain repositories, and groups etc. The way that we do this is normally via Oauth. We have an option called "Login with Artifactory" which will ask the user to authenticate with Artifactory, the Artifactory will return some sort of token to Service Now which can be used to interact with the Artifactory API on behalf of that user. We can drive a real personalized experience for our end customers if we do this. 

Currently, Service Now does not support the ability to be able to act as an Oauth provider. We would see large value in this being a feature, especially for enterprise customers. We are currently on the latest version of Artifactory (SaaS) (Enterprise)

column1: Allow Artifactory to sign jar files using a TSA
column45:
As described in https://jfrog.com/article/sign-jars-automatically/
and detailed in https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/WebStart+and+Jar+Signing
Artifactory can sign jar file using a Key Store. 
It would be very helpful to ad also the option to use a TSA at the signing time, instead of using the metadata from the server.

column1: Add Single Logout URL for Oauth
column45:
Add a Single Logout URL functionality for Oauth.
Where if we logout from Artifactory we will also log out from the Oauth provider.

column1: Single logout point for OpenId service
column45:
OpenId is one of the services that Artifactory supports for Oauth authentication.

In addition, OpenId protocol is a layer on top of the OAuth procol, and in addition to the login option, it supports back and front channels for logout operations.

Some users might want that if we logout from the OpenId services, they will also logout from Artifactory, using this protocol.
So it will also be a single logout point.

More documentation on it you can find here:
http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-backchannel-1_0.html

column1: Add entrypoint in Docker image to allow username and group names to be different
column45:
The docker file/entrypoint used logic such as below.

setAccessCreds() {

    ACCESS_SOURCE_IP_ALLOWED=${ACCESS_SOURCE_IP_ALLOWED:-127.0.0.1}

    ACCESS_CREDS_FILE=${ACCESS_ETC_FOLDER}/bootstrap.creds

    if [ ! -z "${ACCESS_USER}" ] && [ ! -z "${ACCESS_PASSWORD}" ] && [ ! -f ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE} ] ; then

        logger "Creating bootstrap.creds using ACCESS_USER and ACCESS_PASSWORD env variables"

        mkdir -p ${ACCESS_ETC_FOLDER} || errorExit "Couldn't create ${ACCESS_ETC_FOLDER}"

        echo "${ACCESS_USER}@${ACCESS_SOURCE_IP_ALLOWED}=${ACCESS_PASSWORD}" > ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE}

        chmod 600 ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE} || errorExit "Setting permission on ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE} failed"

        chown ${ARTIFACTORY_USER_NAME}:${ARTIFACTORY_USER_NAME} ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE} || errorExit "Setting ownership on ${ACCESS_CREDS_FILE} failed"

    fi

}

 
In that the directories are set with a group that has to be the same as the username.
 
Feature request is to be able to modify the entrypoint and provide another variable so that the username is not used for both the user and the group when setting permissions.

column1: Nuget repository for powershell
column45:
We want to use artifactory nuget repository as powershell repository for our windows servers, the basic functionality is there, however some features are lacking when compared to public Microsofts PSGallery, and that is an issue since users will expect our local powershell repository to behave exactly like the public one.

Currently we missing following functionality:

1. Registering PS repository with providing different location for scripts:
Register-PSRepository -Name InternalPSGallery -SourceLocation "https://company.com/artifactory/api/nuget/db-nuget-psgallery" -PublishLocation https://company.com/artifactory/api/nuget/db-nuget-psgallery " -ScriptSourceLocation "https://company.com/artifactory/api/nuget/db-nuget-psgallery/scripts" -ScriptPublishLocation https://company.com/artifactory/api/nuget/db-nuget-psgallery/scripts

this would be normal use case for powershell repository, Publish-Script successfully uploads the package to /scripts subfolder, however Find-Script fails:
Find-Script -repository InternalPSGallery
should return scripts from db-nuget-psgallery/scripts, instead it errors out:
WARNING: Unable to resolve package source 'https://company.com/artifactory/api/nuget/db-nuget-psgallery/scripts'.

2. Using Find-Script, Find-Module and Find-DSCResource, should return relevant types of packages from repository, however with artifactory repository:
Find-Module returns all packages - scripts, modules, and DSCResources
Find-Script also returns all types of packages
Find-DSCResource returns no results even when there are DSCResources in the repository

this is related to ticket #75366
column249:
25/Jan/18 9:33 AM;Aurimas N.;According to Microsoft Find-DSCResource is not working because repository does not support "tag based search":
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellGet/issues/184

Although myget is mentioned here, behavior with artifactory repository is identical as described on this github issue.

column1: Artifactory built-in "mvn archetype:crawl"
column45:
The archetype-catalog.xml file contains all the maven archetypes (= project templates) that are available in that repository. It is the only way to figure out what archetypes are even available (listed when doing a plain "mvn archetype:generate").

Maven has no other remote crawling mechanism. The below maven plugin doesn't support crawling.

https://github.com/dm-conti/maven-archetype-catalog-plugin

column1: artifactory backups to Azure Blob storage
column45:
We built an artifactory HA on Azure that uses Azure SQL and Azure blob storage.  Backup has been started but it is filling up the storage on each of the HA servers.  For example, we installed artifactory at /var/opt/jfrog/artifactory.  The backup is also in this directory.  How do we direct the backup to the Azure blob storage?

The answer from Frog is:

===============================================

Subject: Re: [#xxxxxx] how to direct artifactory backup to Azure blob storage

Hi Sharene,

Thank you for contacting us.

When working with Artifactory HA, the primary member is responsible to collect and perform the backups and save them at the location you have configured to it.

Currently there is no out of the box configuration which point Artifactory to save the backup directly to S3/Azure/Google storage, you can upload the backups manually or to create a script which will upload the backup automatically.

You are welcome to open feature request for this feature in our public JIRA system and we will contact our Product Manager regard it, if you will open feature request, kindly elaborate about the use case.

 

===============================================

column1: Improve RubyGem metadata efficency
column45:
Current Situation:

Currently the RubyGem Spec file generated by Artifactory contains duplicate strings, making the file very large compared to a similar file generated by [https://rubygems.org/|https://rubygems.org/].

This difference is not detectable during operations on a small to medium Artifactory Gems repository, however as the number of Gem files increase the larger the spec file becomes. 

Steps to reproduce:
At around 180,000 artifacts, the Gem client needs far more time to process the Artifactory Gem Spec file compared to the one it pulls from rubygems.org. This can be observed by checking the sizes of the two spec files:

*du .gem/specs/
40488    .gem/specs/[ART_URL]%8081/artifactory/api/gems/gems-virtual
[...]
15712    .gem/specs/api.rubygems.org%443*

Current workarounds are to have smaller RubyGem repositories to limit the metadata size. 

A potential solution to this problem would be to generate a gemspec metadata file that contains pointers to shared strings; this is what rubygems.org does to keep its metadata file small.

column45:
I find the current level of integration between xray and artifactory to be lacking.  I frequently am looking at an artifact (like a docker image) in side artifactory and I notice the xray properties show an old scanned date.  In that case I'd want to go to the actions menu and select 'Scan in xray' behind the scenes artifactory would perform the API calls to have xray scan the image.

Also I frequently find myself in the position where an artifact in artifactory shows that it's xray status is 'indexed' but the component does not exist in the xray components search... in those cases I'd want to go to the actions menu and select 'Index in xray' or perhaps the same 'Scan in xray' if the feature was smart enough to send an index request then a scan request.

column1: Keyserver cache feature
column45:
It will be nice to have an feature that allow cache Debian/Ubuntu signing keys from key servers. For example keyserver.ubuntu.com.

*For what?*
For fully cache a remote Debian/Ubuntu packages. For now I can only cache remote Debian/Ubuntu single package but I still need obtain a signing key from key server. It is a bloker for setup Artifactory as a single point of access for all Debian/Ubuntu packages. I mean to treat Artifactory as a key server proxy to official key servers.

*How It looks now?*
An example below
# sudo add-apt-repository "deb https://artifactory.mydomain.com/some-remote-repo trusty main"
# sudo apt-get update
After the update command, I got an message that is no signing key for repository which I added in step one. So I have to do that
3. sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys <key_hash>

*What I need*
Download signing key through the Artifactory
{code}
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver artifactory.mydomain.com --recv-keys <key_hash>
{code}

column1: Automatic recovery from cached files with bad checksums
column45:
See ticket #71202

When a client tries to download an artifact from Artifactory, but it has a bad checksum, the following error is returned:

"status" : 409,
"message" : "Rejected artifact download request: Checksum policy 'GEN_IF_ABSENT' rejected the artifact <docker cache repo>:<path>. Checksums info: ChecksumsInfo{checksums={SHA1=ChecksumInfo{type=SHA-1, original='<original sha1>', actual='<actual sha1>'}. MD5=ChecksumInfo{type=MD5, original='<original md5>', actual='<actual md5>'}}}

The only workaround right now is to manually delete the file in the cache and initiate another request to have artifactory resync from source repo.  Artifactory should have a feature where it can automatically resync the file if there is a bad checksum and then serve the file instead of returning this error.

- disable the username and password fields in the UI once Google OAuth is enabled
- deactivate the "admin" user so that no-one can login without Google OAuth

We would still want to be able to enable the admin login on-demand for operations/backup purposes. Please advise.

column1: Not able to store broken symlinks in Artifactory (version 5.4.5)
column45:
[#anchor]Test scenario:

We have two different baselines (let's call them SW and SDK). The SW has a structure like this:


{code:java}
.
|-- SDK
|   |-- bin
|   |   `-- compiler
|   `-- lib
|       `-- library.so
`-- SW
    |-- SDK -> ../SDK
    |-- binary
    |   |-- bin1
    |   `-- bin2
    `-- headers
        |-- file1.h
        `-- file2.h

{code}

We want to upload the SW baseline without the SDK baseline to artifactory.
So the Link in SW/SDK is broken, because SDK does not exist during the upload to artifactory.

Uploading both at the same time is not an option. It will double the time of the upload.
column249:
02/Oct/18 7:33 PM;TrinhTa;On 5 November 2017, Kfir Avraham replied in JFrog Ticket 70836 that "If we understand correctly, you would like to upload files to Artifactory when there is a broken symlink. We have an open [Jira ticket|https://www.jfrog.com/jira/browse/JGC-143] regarding exclude option for bad symlink, which will allow to exclude bad symlinks and upload to Artifactory."

The above is exactly what we need. But the Jira ticket mentioned above (https://www.jfrog.com/jira/browse/JGC-143) no longer exists. What happens to it?

column1: Extend /api/security/users/:user to non admins
column45:
Currently the /api/security/users/:user only accepts requests from admin users. However, many use cases exists for non-admins to verify information about themselves. Our primary use case is related to a wrapper API around Artifactory. We want a user interacting with out API to provide us with basic authentication and we pass that information to Artifactory to validate that the credentials are valid within LDAP and that the user exists in Artifactory. Our current workaround is to use a different endpoint to validate credentials.

The expected behavior would look like:

User joe would be allowed to hit /api/security/users/joe, but joe would get forbidden when trying to hit /api/security/users/sam.

column1: Artifactory cannot detect the Access port when a protocol other than "HTTP/1.1" is used
column45:
Tomcat HTTP connectors have their "protocol" attribute set to "HTTP/1.1" by default. Some customers use other variations or explicit types HTTP connectors such as:

org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11AprProtocol

While HTTP is a must, the first two are HTTP connectors and Access should be able to detect them at start up, and for unsupported connectors, throw an exception that indicates that HTTP is required and suggest configuring the Access URL explicitly to be the frontend URL with the "artifactory.access.client.serverUrl.override" (and maybe "artifactory.access.server.bundled" too).

* The problem is that we query for available connectors from the MBeanServer object using "HTTP/1.1" as an explicit value @ TomcatUtils#getHttpConnectors().

column1: Show Actual Size of Requests/Reponses in Request.log in addition to the content length
column45:
Currently in Artifactory's request.log will only show the content-length of the requests.

It would help users that charge bandwidth to have the option to see the actual response size.

e.g.

*Current Behavior*
When user downloads a file completely:
20171115213731|32214|REQUEST|64.71.2.34|admin|GET|/debian-local/support-bundle-20171110-1606201-1510329980196.zip|HTTP/1.1|200|*46679797*

When user downloads the same file and cancels before it's done:
20171115213334|3789|REQUEST|64.71.2.34|admin|GET|/debian-local/support-bundle-20171110-1606201-1510329980196.zip|HTTP/1.1|200|*46679797*


*Possible Desired Behavior*
download a file completely:
20171115213731|32214|REQUEST|64.71.2.34|admin|GET|/debian-local/support-bundle-20171110-1606201-1510329980196.zip|HTTP/1.1|200|*46679797*|*46679797*

download the same file and cancel before it's done:
20171115213334|3789|REQUEST|64.71.2.34|admin|GET|/debian-local/support-bundle-20171110-1606201-1510329980196.zip|HTTP/1.1|200|*46679797*|*734253*
column249: 16/Nov/17 2:33 PM;chenwen9;Hi Jfrog,  it is meaningful to have the real response/request size in the request log. Please help to implement as soon as possible. Thanks a lot.

column1: Support interception of ":statistics" requests with User Plugins
column45: Similar to the afterPropertyCreate event, we can introduce a user-plugin event for statistics such as "afterStatisticsCreate" or "afterStatisticsUpdate".  The need for that arises from the fact that smart remote repos replicate stats on an independent request. An example use-case is copying artifacts from one repo to another in afterCreate. This is something that can be triggered by replication requests, however, doing that, you don't have the ability to replicate stats when replication updates them on a regular basis.

column1: Override Access source IP by environment variable
Include/Exclude pattern for repositories when setting permission targets
column45:
There is already an include/exclude pattern for artifact paths when defining permission targets. What would be great would be the ability to include/exclude repositories themselves as well.

Being able to define a repository pattern would mean that we would not have to manually add repositories to permission targets as we create them, therefore working dynamically in a similar way to how the "Any Local Repository" and "Any Remote Repository" checkboxes work their magic. We would arguably also need to create far less permission targets to accommodate our use case.

Initially raised with JFrog support in ticket [71109|https://support.jfrog.com/jFrogCasePage?id=500w000001pwpIfAAI]
column249: 26/Jul/18 1:54 PM;jason.ko;+1 we need this functionality.

column1: Add the ability to select multiple git provider in php composer.
column45: Add the ability to select multiple git provider in php composer - there are repositories which provide download links from multiple git providers.

column1: API for non-admin users to list the aggregated repositories within the Virtual repository
column45:
Currently there is no REST API available for users to list aggregated repositories within Virtual repository.  User must be admin and parse the config file which takes unnecessary time.  Many users request information and the information is available via the GUI but would be nice to access the same info using the REST API.

Workarounds:

1.  User plugin
2.  Use the Trace Artifact Retrieval api call and request a non-existing file.
     Then grep for Searching to obtain a list of all repositories searched
         curl http://<url>/artifactory/example-virtual/non-existant-file.txt?trace | grep "Searching"

column1: Exclude specific repositories from cache-fs
column45:
In a large Artifactory installation with many types of repos, some repositories may have extremely large artifacts which are pulled infrequently (example: a docker container that has incredibly large layers). Even in a temporary situation, this can take up large amounts of cache room (in the order of 20-50gb per in our case). 

As a user, I'd like to be able to exclude repositories from caching in a cache-fs binarystore configuration when the binary store is backed by remote storage (S3). This would help alleviate local storage needs, while giving many artifacts faster download times.

column1: Ability to add sub-jobs published modules on Artifactory after each build phase
column45: The use Case is to have several sub builds as part of the main build. These sub builds may be used in one or more main builds. We would like artifactory to show these as builds under a master build in the build browser.

column1: GPG sign .rpm files along with repomd.xml
column45:
Currently Artifactory will only sign an RPM repository's repomd.xml file. It will only generate repomd.xml.asc and repomd.xml.key files under the repodata folder.

A useful feature to ensure the RPM files themselves have been signed would be to add an option to sign them. This would use Artifactory's existing GPG signing functionality, extended to .rpm files. This is already done by Bintray, and would enhance Artifactory's functionality.

As this may be a more computationally intensive task, this could probably be implemented as a toggle-able option under the Signing section of the Artifactory UI, or a system setting.

column1: Virtual Puppet repositories should offer Forge API
column249:
31/May/18 12:46 PM;yonatanb@jfrog.com;Dear Taciano, 

Thank you for reaching JFrog Support. 

With regards to the scenario you are experiencing, we would like to update that this is the desired behaviour as this API call can only be served by local or remote repositories. 

Since you are asking for us to add this also to the virtual repository, we have changed the JIRA type from "bug" to "feature request". 

As you may know, our roadmap is tightly scheduled according to community feedback.

We hope this clarifies further. 

Best Regards, 
Yonatan Brand

column1: Add an "Export Trashcan" option
column45:
If a user does not want to lose the data in their Trash Can, they currently have no way of preserving its contents long term. This is a problem for some data retention policies.

As the Trash Can works in a similar way to an Artifactory Repository, there should be a way to export its contents from the Export and Import UI menu.

column1: Add option to disable "Empty Trash Can" UI item
column45:
The current problem is that it is very easy to empty the Artifactory Trash Can, which would permanently delete the artifacts there. 

Currently only Artifactory administrators can see and empty the Trash Can. While this solution works for most use cases, Artifactories with a large pool of admin users are more open to random emptying.

The solution would be to add an option under the General Configuration to disable the UI elements of the trashcan for administrators. The only way the trashcan would be deleted would be at its scheduled cron job time.

column1: Prevent deletion of non-empty folders
column45: At the repository level, we want the capability to disable deletion of non-empty folders/repositories. This will prevent an entire folder/repository from being deleted by mistake.

column1: Session UI Timeout should be configurable in the GUI
column45: Session timeout configuration is now configurable in artifactory.system.properties, but it should be configurable in the UI as well.

column1: Option to provide retry for triggered and scheduled replication process.
column45:
Add option to configure triggered replication to retry after failure.

In a unstable network when triggered replication the deployed artifact is not available on the remote mirrors until the next scheduled replication.

Include an option for the number of times to retry.
column249: 20/Oct/17 5:23 PM;bob.laughton;This is a very important feature for us as it would help us with unexpected network drops as if a replication fails there is know way to go back except for a scheduled cleanup job later.

column1: Allow users to add and modify files under the repodata folder
column45:
This issue is related to the JFrog ticket number: #68985

The issue is that Artifactory limits us to using 4 files under the repodata folder, which we cannot modify the files or add more files to the folder.
 
However, our team needs to add additional XML files to the repodata folder and needs to modify the repomd.xml file to link the additional files. 

*The feature we want is to add and modify XML files under the repodata folder.*

Currently, this is what Artifactory's repodata folder looks like:
{code}
repomd.xml
primary.xml.gz
other.xml.gz
filelist.xml.gz
{code}

However, our team uses SUSE's metadata files and wants the repodata folder to look like this:
{code}
repomd.xml --- need to edit this file 
primary.xml.gz
other.xml.gz
filelist.xml.gz
updateinfo.xml  --- we need this file to be added in the repodata folder
deltainfo.xml --- we need this file to be added in the repodata folder
{code}

We have tried adding the updateinfo.xml file and modifying the repomd.xml file in Artifactory ourselves, but the repodata folder gets refreshed and our changes get erased.

It is crucial for our team to use SUSE's metadata as we rely on it to pick up patches for packages with the label "security", and this metadata information is contained in the updateinfo.xml file.

column1: add support for encrypted database connection
column45: Currently Artifactory does not recognize properties added to the connection url and treats it as part of the url.

column1: Generate report of build records (WebUi)

column1: Repository Browser bug with chinese characters
column45: When you supply chinese characters in a deployment path, you cannot browse to the file in the Artifactory browser due to a bad URL. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a file with chinese characters (Ex: 超人.txt) 2. Upload to Artifactory with a deployment path also in Chinese (Ex: PUT artifactory/libs-release-local/超人/超人.txt ) 3. Navigate to upload repository in the browser, not the Artifacts Browser WebUI EX: http://localhost:8081/artifactory/libs-release-local/ 4. Observe that the URL linking to the file is invalid: 超人/ -> http://localhost:8081/artifactory/libs-release-local/%C3%A8%C2%B6%E2%80%A6%C3%A4%C2%BA%C2%BA/ This be proven if you view the HTML source for the page: 超人/ 26-Sep-2017 14:37

column1: Set admin initial password for a pre-configured artifactory instance
column45:
*Problem Description:*

As Artifactory default admin password must be modified, customers who which to pre-configure artifactory in order to enable self-service provisioning, require a way to set the defualt admin password via configuration file

*Proposed Solution:*

On-top of having the option of bootstrapping the security xml by following:

[https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Configuration+Files#ConfigurationFiles-BootstrappingtheSecurityConfiguration]

Artifactory should provide an option to update the admin password default password via a yaml file
column249:
08/Nov/17 8:58 AM;luc.stroobant@wdc.com;Some arguments why we requested this: it will be easier to automate the installation. We create idempotent Ansible roles to install our Artifactory, so we run this role to install a server, but also to add new nodes in a HA setup where we run the role a second time against all hosts in the cluster. If you can configure the initial password in artifactory.config.import.yml, you're sure that there is no doubt about the password. Once Artifactory is started, the password is set to the configured value.

Using the API to change the password from the default "password" to something custom at the initial installation is possible, but it will complicate things. You need a check to find out if this is an initial install and test somewhere if the password has been changed before. It's not really elegant to call the api and check for a 403 and it might even block the admin account if something goes wrong.
column250: 10/Dec/19 5:15 PM;prathameshd9;Would definitely like this setting. Customizing Artifactory Docker instance with the admin password NOT being the default one is a great security boost.

column1: Timezone in docker image
column45:
Currently the timezone for the docker image docker.bintray.io/jfrog/artifactory-pro is set to Etc/UTC and it affects build time for builds.

{code:java}
docker exec -it artifactory cat /etc/timezone
{code}

Would be nice if we can set the timezone through docker-compose file like:


{code:java}
version "2"

services:
  artifactory:
    image: docker.bintray.io/jfrog/artifactory-pro:5.4.6
    environment:
      TZ: "Europe/Paris"
    ...
{code}

For the moment I use my local files (/etc/timezone and /etc/localtime) as volume in the docker-container :

{code:java}
version: '2'
services:
  artifactory:
    image: docker.bintray.io/jfrog/artifactory-pro:5.4.6
    ...
    volumes:
     - /data/artifactory:/var/opt/jfrog/artifactory
     - /etc/timezone:/etc/timezone:ro
     - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
   ...
{code}

This issue comes from Github i have posted : https://github.com/JFrogDev/artifactory-docker-examples/issues/39

Thanks!

column1: Allow exclude content for backups
column45: There should be an option to exclude content for backups (similar to that present in a system export), so the time of backups can be reduced for large instances by not exporting the file store.
column249:
10/Jul/19 8:53 PM;trapexit;+1

Keeping a full metadata backup is very useful. If you have a separate policy for backing up your filestore there is no reason to bother with backing up the filestore through Artifactory. The Artifactory metadata however is critical and automating System Exports out of band is clumsy when Backup already does this.

Allow scheduled System Exports or allow excluding content in backups.

column1: Want to set HTTP Reason Phrase from Artifactory Plugin
column45:
Hi!

Have a look at this Artifactory plugin:
https://github.com/clolin/artifactory-user-plugins/blob/master/governance/preventXrayRejected/preventXrayRejected.groovy

Can we get a plugin like this to modify the HTTP Response Reason Phrase?

The use case is that we want to pass a message from our plugin to Maven users.

If you try to build using Maven, the message set in this example will never reach the user, like this:
"
[ERROR] Plugin org.codehaus.mojo:license-maven-plugin:1.8 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not transfer artifact org.codehaus.mojo:license-maven-plugin:jar:1.8 from/to central (http://gew1-artifactory4gcp-a-pkj5:8081/artifactory/libs-release): Access denied to: http://gew1-artifactory4gcp-a-pkj5:8081/artifactory/libs-release/org/codehaus/mojo/license-maven-plugin/1.8/license-maven-plugin-1.8.jar , ReasonPhrase:Forbidden. -> [Help 1]
"

But the HTTP Reason Phrase would ("ReasonPhrase:Forbidden" in the above example), that's why we want to be able to modify it.

Note that as long as the Reason Phrase doesn't contain any newlines, it is fine to put anything in there:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec6.html#sec6.1.1

See also the conversation here:
https://support.jfrog.com/jFrogCasePage?id=500w000001kovS8
column249:
11/Sep/17 12:03 PM;drorb;In order to set the HTTP reason phrase from a Java servlet you need to:
* Use the deprecated {{HttpServletResponse#setStatus(int sc, java.lang.String sm)}} method which allows setting the reason phrase. This method is deprecated since Servlet 2.1
* Set the tomcat [org.apache.coyote.USE_CUSTOM_STATUS_MSG_IN_HEADER|http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/config/systemprops.html] property to true

As a side note, HTTP 2.0 remove 'reason phrase' from the spec

column1: Configure "Folder Download Settings" setting by repository
column45:
Currently, Artifactory can be configured to allow users to zip up and download directories using the "Folder Download Settings" section of the General Configuration Admin page. 

The settings there are currently global, however some users feel it would be best if they could configure them on a per-repository basis, allowing some directories to be more accessible than others.

column1: Anonymous access to repository but not GUI
column45:
h3. Current behaviour
To grant anonymous access to a certain repository, one has to allow anonymous access to Artifactory in the security configuration, which enables access to the frontend without authentication.

h3. Desired behaviour
We would like to be able to make certain repositories available without the need of authentication (anonymous acces) but at the same time still have login to access the frontend mandatory.

h3. Reason
We'd like to be able to implement Knowledge Base Article Number: 000002787 "How to  install phantomjs-prebuilt?" without opening up our whole installation to everyone without authentication.

Future applications might include the distribution of binaries to clients who aren't mapped in Artifactory, thus not having login permissions anyway.

column1: User API Key & Password management page
column45:
1. For audibility it would be good to know if the user has setup the API key and how old the key is. If the key hits an age threshold then we can request to reset the API key if its not a service account.
2. For the API key too it would be nice to track when it was last used, so if there are any stale API keys they can be disabled or reset after a certain time.(for example 90-days)
3. The same goes for the password and encrypted password. If you are using SSO this does not play a part. But if it is a 'local' account the password expiry policy is enabled it should apply to local accounts not the SSO .
4. Looking for the users screen to have last browser login, last cli login, password age.

column1: Hide inclusion pattern expression in virtual repository
column45:
Users would like to remove inclusion patterns as an option for virtual repositories, in order to let folder levels match more effectively.

For example, if the inclusion pattern "ex/jfrog/**" is added, and this new option is enabled, the package "ex/jfrog/com/test/foo.bar" would show up in the virtual repository as "com/test/foo.bar".

This way packages from multiple local repositories can show up under the same folder structure and be organized better.

column1: Tracking user-changes in ActiveDirectory using uniqueID or other fields
column45:
In order to track user-renames in the Active Directory/Crowd, Artifactory should track username-changes with a customisable field.
* uniqueID
* email
* ...

This way users won't be duplicated and users will not lose privileges in the application when a rename occurs.
This will affect our instance with +- 30k users in a few weeks time.

column1: Enable delete build’s artifact if build flow fails after uploading artifacts via Jenkins
column45:
You create a multiJob in Jenkins with 2 child streams.
Child stream jobs upload artifacts related to their parent job to a common repository & path in artifactory, named with the parent build number.
The parent job also upload artifact during run or after child stream jobs finish.

It is required to delete all uploads if one of the child stream job fails & there are missing artifacts. This affects the failure of its parent job.

The reason - 
If another a job takes latest (snapshot) artifacts of that build - it wouldn't "know" there are missing artifacts in the build.

Scheme:
/Parent/Build#1
/Parent/build#1/child1Aretifacts                 successfully uploaded (created first)
/Parent/build#1/child2AretifactsMissing     is missing artifacts or failed child job run
/Parent/Build#1/ParentArtifact             artifact was uploaded though there are missing artifacts

*build#1 is the parent build number

Job 2 tries to download artifacts of /Parent/Build#1 but missing child2Aretifacts

column1: Enable promote an artifact of any previous build rather than last build.
column45: Sometimes you had like to promote an old created artifact, which its build does not appear in Jenkins (build was deleted but artifact exists in artifactory) & cannot be promoted via the Jenkins build list. You had like to promote this build via Jenkins as you know it is exists & creted by a specific job.
column249:
10/Apr/18 12:36 PM;yonatanb@jfrog.com;Hi Yoav, 

Thank you for reaching us.

With regards to the scenario you are presenting, we would like to clarify and suggest a solution. 
When we perform a promotion we do it for a whole build and not just for a single artifact. Artifactory will know from the build info (name and number) what artifacts need to be promoted. 

In the scenario you present, you say the build is no longer in Jenkins, and this is why you cannot perform the promotion from Jenkins. 
As a workaround, if the build info still exists in Artifactory, although it is not in Jenkins, you can use ["Working With Pipeline Jobs in Jenkins"|https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Working+With+Pipeline+Jobs+in+Jenkins#WorkingWithPipelineJobsinJenkins-PromotingBuildsinArtifactory]. You will just need to change the buildName and buildNumber accordingly and the artifacts associated with this buildInfo will be promoted. 

We hope this clarifies more. 

Yonatan Brand
JFrog Support.

column1: Add checkbox for selecting whether to fail the build if there are missing artifacts
column45:
It is required to validate that all artifacts are uploaded/ downloaded.
If there is a missing artifact specifically indicated at the Artifactory Jnkins plugin (by file or plugin interface) or If a path to artifact does not exists, there should be a checkbox enables the user to decide if to fail the build or not.
column249:
13/May/18 2:45 PM;yonatanb@jfrog.com;Hi Yoav, 

Thank you for submitting this feature request. 

We would like to clarify that before the plugin deploys the build info it deploys the build artifacts.
In case one of the build artifacts did not go through, which means we received a response different than 200, then the whole build would fail.

We hope this clarifies further. 

If any additional assistance is still required, please reach us by email at support@jfrog.com.

Best Regards,
Yonatan Brand
JFrog Support

column1: Encrypt Artifactory license keys that are on the filesystem
column45: Encrypt Artifactory license keys that are on the filesystem

column1: Support public/private key exchange payload encryption
column45:
As part of JFrog crypto.
Goal is to send public key to sender, and have EndToEnd encryption payload.
Payload format: CC.KKKKKK.PPPPPPPP
CC = Code of encryption
KKKKKKK = Encrypted with public key of 128 random generated bytes
PPPPPPP = AES128 encrypted payload from the above random bytes. With last 2 bytes of double sha2 byte array of encrypted bytes.

column1: JFrog Crypto supports for old keys and keys identification
column45:
In order to allow clean migration from old key to new key the EncriptionWrapper should support chaining: Main one (encrypt/decrypt), next ones multiple decrypt capabilities
And each decrypt should read if encrypted by given key.
Changing the format of the encrypted data to: {{CC.YYYYYY.XXXXXXXXX}} where :
CC = EncodingType code
YYYYYY = First 3 bytes in hex format of the sha2 of the private key
XXXXXXXX = The encrypted payload with the last 2 bytes of the double sha2(sha2()) of the byte array payload (already done like this in JFrog Crypto)

column1: Extend RestAPI with 'Fix checksums' call
column45: Currently the only way to restore checksums of already published artefacts, which are lacking a client published checksum value, is to click in the UI on the 'Fix checksums' button. It would be way easier to script this for an administrator by performing a RestAPI call. This call should have similar functionality as the 'Set Item SHA256 checksum' RestAPI call (https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-SetItemSHA256Checksum), in other words supplying a repoKey and path which will result in recursive applying of fix checksum.

column1: Add "Readme" option to distribution repositories
column45:
Bintray recently added "Readme" and "Release Notes" sections to package pages in the web UI. A new feature would be a way for to specify these fields for artifacts distributed to Bintray.

This could be set by detecting a file specifically called "Readme" that is found among the artifacts to distribute. It could be attached to a special Artifactory property much like how the "Map Properties to Bintray Attributes" setting works.

Adding this feature would also users to distribute their packages automatically and speed up publishing releases to Bintray.

column1: Artifactory should verify local copy of InRelease is up-to-date
NPM "deprecate" command does nothing
column45:
Running the NPM "deprecate" command on packages in Artifactory does not add the deprecation message or change the NPM package's metadata. There is no indication of a failure when the command is ran, when pulling the package no message is displayed.

This can be reproduced by deprecating a package proxied by Artifactory:

npm deprecate busybox "Testing message"
jfrog@ip-10-6-17-44:~/development/npm$ npm install busybox

> busybox@2017.3.22 postinstall /home/jfrog/development/npm/node_modules/busybox
> if [ -f npm_scripts.sh ]; then ./npm_scripts.sh postinstall; fi

npm@1.0.0 /home/jfrog/development/npm
└── busybox@2017.3.22

In the Artifactory logs the "deprecate" command is reaching Artifactory:
20170805091818|1200|REQUEST|127.0.0.1|admin|GET|/api/npm/npm/busybox|HTTP/1.1|200|0
20170805091818|91|REQUEST|127.0.0.1|admin|PUT|/api/npm/npm/busybox|HTTP/1.1|201|22438

If this feature is not supported there should be an error message when users attempt to add the deprecation in Artifactory.
column249: 14/Apr/20 2:28 PM;tom.wilcox;Any update on this one? We would like to see support for `npm deprecate` command in Artifactory.
column250: 04/Sep/20 12:43 PM;bmorenc;This is a foundational requirement for artifact management that we have very high interest in.  Without it we must rely on supplemental communications to inform users about these kinds of package changes.

Initial use case is to use it for auditing descriptor changes, but there are other activities one can imagine in complex topologies where being able to track these changes would be useful.

Hi folks,

I'd like to make a feature request for binary storage support for Oracle's Bare Metal Cloud Service (BMCS) Object Store (BMC's S3-like service).   

I'll add that BMCS will be adding an S3 compatible API very soon which might aid in this delivery of this feature.

Thanks,

Jeff

30/Oct/17 5:00 PM;jeffbeard;Hi folks,

I wanted to follow up on this request.

Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) now has S3 API compatibility and I would like to ask JFrog to collaborate with the OCI team to verify that compatibility a head of us doing our Artifactory build in OCI. 

I have the contact info of the appropriate OCI stakeholders and would like to see if we can prioritize not a development effort per se but a verification effort on the OCI Object Store S3 API.
